snippet: A federal judge ruled that the practice of stopping people suspected of trespassing outside private buildings in the Bronx was unconstitutional.
abstract: Federal Judge Shira A Scheindlin rules that New York City Police Department's practice of stopping people suspected of trespassing outside private residential buildings in Bronx is unconstitutional; ruling may have broad implications for city's widespread use of police stops as a crime-fighting tactic.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge ruled that the practice of stopping people suspected of trespassing outside private buildings in the Bronx was unconstitutional.

headline.seo: Judge Limits N.Y.P.D. Stop-and-Frisk Program in Bronx
headline.main: Police Stop-and-Frisk Program in Bronx Is Ruled Unconstitutional
headline.print_headline: Police Stop-and-Frisk Program in Bronx Is Ruled Unconstitutional
